definitions.definition: The interior bottom or surface of a house or building; the supporting surface of a room.
definitions.example: The room has a wooden floor.

definitions.definition: Ground (surface of the Earth, as opposed to the sky or water or underground).
The lower inside surface of a hollow space.
definitions.example: Many sunken ships rest on the ocean floor.

definitions.definition: A structure formed of beams, girders, etc, with proper covering, which divides a building horizontally into storeys/stories.
The supporting surface or platform of a structure such as a bridge.
definitions.example: Wooden planks of the old bridge's floor were nearly rotten.

definitions.definition: A storey/story of a building.
definitions.example: For years we lived on the third floor.

definitions.definition: In a parliament, the part of the house assigned to the members, as opposed to the viewing gallery.
Hence, the right to speak at a given time during a debate or other public event.
definitions.example: The mayor often gives a lobbyist the floor.

definitions.definition: That part of the bottom of a vessel on each side of the keelson which is most nearly horizontal.
The rock underlying a stratified or nearly horizontal deposit.
A horizontal, flat ore body.
The largest integer less than or equal to a given number.
An event performed on a floor-like carpeted surface.
A floor-like carpeted surface for performing gymnastic movements.
A lower limit on the interest rate payable on an otherwise variable-rate loan, used by lenders to defend against falls in interest rates. Opposite of a cap.
A dance floor.
The area in which business is conducted at a convention or exhibition
To cover or furnish with a floor.
definitions.example: floor a house with pine boards

definitions.definition: To strike down or lay level with the floor; to knock down.
(driving) To accelerate rapidly.
definitions.example: As soon as our driver saw an insurgent in a car holding a detonation device, he floored the pedal and was 2,000 feet away when that car bomb exploded. We escaped certain death in the nick of time!

definitions.definition: To silence by a conclusive answer or retort.
definitions.example: Floored or crushed by him. — Coleridge

definitions.definition: To amaze or greatly surprise.
definitions.example: We were floored by his confession.

definitions.definition: To finish or make an end of.
definitions.example: I've floored my little-go work — ed Hughes

definitions.definition: To set a lower bound.
